metadata.title: CVE-2017-9064 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In WordPress before 4.7.5, a Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF)vulnerability exists in the filesystem credentials dialog because a nonceis not required for updating credentials.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.5+dfsg1-1').
